target_text: "Yes, very important question! Software quality is first and most the product confirms to the requirements and free of defects."

Role.Subject: Geography
Role.positionality:
Five dimensions
- Role Identity: Product Owner
- Intended Study Level: Masters
- Subject (QS): Geography
- Research Interest (NSF): Economics
- Biases/Assumptions: Epistemological (pragmatic-positivist)

Positionality statement
I am a Product Owner pursuing a Master’s in Geography, bringing product strategy, stakeholder coordination, and spatial thinking to my research. I study economic geography to translate spatial-economic patterns into actionable insights for decision-makers. Epistemologically, I lean pragmatic-positivist: I privilege measurable evidence, causal inference, and implementable models, while recognizing their limits. This positionality leads me to frame questions around optimization and user value and to read user responses as requirements, which can underweight lived experience. I mitigate by triangulating quantitative analysis with participatory methods and reflecting on how question framing and responses shape interpretation.

Codebook.role: Qualitative SE/HCI Researcher — PhD Candidate; Discipline: Computer Science (Software Engineering); NSF Interest: Human-Centered Computing; Reflexivity: privileges user-centric quality, cautious of compliance bias.

codebook.justification: [confirms to the requirements]. Frames quality as spec compliance—a contested, interpretive criterion shaped by acceptance criteria and stakeholder negotiation.
[free of defects]. Zero-defect is an aspirational construct; defect taxonomies, test coverage, and severity thresholds encode subjective trade-offs.
[first and most]. Establishes a normative hierarchy of quality cues, influencing weighting functions and evaluation heuristics in SE practice.
